meanings.definition: A shaft or bar used to hold or support material being machined.
meanings.sent1: The machinist inserted the mandrels into the metal piece before starting the work.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a mandrels to secure the wood in place while cutting.
meanings.sent3: The mandrels decided to take a break and support a cup of coffee instead of metal.
meanings.sent4: The mandrels of the clock turned smoothly, shaping time as it passed.
meanings.sent5: The mandrels, like a sturdy pillar, held the weight of the material without faltering.

meanings.definition: A spindle used to shape or form material.
meanings.sent1: The potter carefully placed the clay on the mandrels to shape it into a vase.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor used a mandrels to carve intricate designs into the marble.
meanings.sent3: The mandrels spun around, pretending to be a DJ at a material party.
meanings.sent4: The mandrels spun like a whirlwind, shaping the material effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The mandrels danced along the material, leaving behind a trail of perfectly formed shapes.

meanings.definition: A tool used in metalworking to shape or enlarge a hole.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic selected the appropriate mandrels to enlarge the hole in the metal sheet.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith used a mandrels to shape the metal rod into a perfect circle.
meanings.sent3: The mandrels played hide and seek with the hole, trying to fit perfectly inside.
meanings.sent4: The mandrels worked like magic, expanding the hole with precision.
meanings.sent5: The mandrels transformed the hole, making it larger and more defined.
